008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.image.access;
010
011import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
012import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
016import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
017import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.PixelInterpolator;
018
019/**
020 * The common (abstract) super-class for all image accessors to scalar-valued
021 * images. It inherits all methods from {@link ImageAccessor} but adds the
022 * methods {@link #getVal(int, int)}, {@link #getVal(double, double)} and
023 * {@link #setVal(int, int, float)} for reading and writing scalar-valued pixel
024 * data.
025 */
026public abstract class ScalarAccessor extends ImageAccessor {
027
028        private final PixelInterpolator interpolator; // performs interpolation
029
030        ScalarAccessor(ImageProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
031                super(ip, obs, ipm);
032                this.interpolator = PixelInterpolator.create(interpolationMethod);
033        }
034
035        /**
036         * Creates a new image accessor of general type {@link ScalarAccessor}. The conrete type
037         * of the returned instance depends on the specified image, i.e., {@link ByteAccessor}
038         * for {@link ByteProcessor}, {@link ShortAccessor} for {@link ShortProcessor},
039         * {@link FloatAccessor} for {@link FloatProcessor}.
040         * 
041         * @param ip  the image to be accessed
042         * @param obs the out-of-bounds strategy to be used (use {@code null} for
043         *            default settings)
044         * @param ipm the interpolation method to be used (use {@code null} for default
045         *            settings)
046         * @return a new image accessor
047         */
048        public static ScalarAccessor create(ImageProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
049                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
050                        return new ByteAccessor((ByteProcessor) ip, obs, ipm);
051                if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
052                        return new ShortAccessor((ShortProcessor) ip, obs, ipm);
053                if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
054                        return new FloatAccessor((FloatProcessor) ip, obs, ipm);
055                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
056                                "cannot create " + ScalarAccessor.class.getSimpleName() + " for " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
057        }
058        
059        @Override
060        public int getDepth() {
061                return 1;
062        }
063        
064        @Override
065        public ScalarAccessor getComponentAccessor(int k) {
066                checkComponentIndex(k);
067                return this;
068        }
069
070        /**
071         * Reads and returns the scalar pixel value for the given image position. The
072         * value returned for coordinates outside the image boundaries depends on the
073         * {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy} specified for this {@link ImageAccessor}.
074         * 
075         * @param u the x-coordinate
076         * @param v the y-coordinate
077         * @return the pixel value ({@code float})
078         */
079        public abstract float getVal(int u, int v); // returns pixel value at integer position (u, v)
080        
081        @Override
082        public float getVal(int u, int v, int k) {
083                checkComponentIndex(k);
084                return this.getVal(u, v);
085        }
086        
087        @Override
088        public float getVal(double x, double y, int k) {
089                checkComponentIndex(k);
090                return this.getVal(x, y);
091        }
092
093        /**
094         * Reads and returns the interpolated scalar pixel value for the given image
095         * position. The value returned for coordinates outside the image boundaries
096         * depends on the {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy} specified for this
097         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
098         * 
099         * @param x the x-coordinate
100         * @param y the y-coordinate
101         * @return the pixel value ({@code float})
102         */
103        public float getVal(double x, double y) { // interpolating version
104                return interpolator.getInterpolatedValue(this, x, y);
105        }
106
107        /**
108         * Writes a scalar pixel value to the given image position. 
109         * An exception is thrown if u, v coordinates are outside the image.
110         * 
111         * @param u   the x-coordinate
112         * @param v   the y-coordinate
113         * @param val the new pixel value ({@code float})
114         */
115        public abstract void setVal(int u, int v, float val);
116        
117        public void setVal(int u, int v, int k, float val) {
118                if (k == 0) {
119                        this.setVal(u, v, val);
120                }
121                else {
122                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("invalid component index " + k);
123                }
124        }
125
126        @Override
127        public float[] getPix(int u, int v) {
128                return new float[] { this.getVal(u, v) };
129        }
130
131        @Override
132        public float[] getPix(double x, double y) {
133                return new float[] { this.getVal(x, y) };
134        }
135
136        @Override
137        public void setPix(int u, int v, float[] pix) {
138                this.setVal(u, v, pix[0]);
139        }
140        
141        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
142        
143//      @Override
144//      public void setDefaultValue(float val) {
145//              this.defaultValue = val;
146//      }
147        
148//      public void setDefaultValue(float[] vals) {
149//              if (vals.length != 1) {
150//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("default values must be of length " + 1);
151//              }
152//              this.setDefaultValue(vals[0]);
153//      }
154        
155        @Override
156        void checkComponentIndex(int k) {
157                if (k != 0) {
158                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("invalid component index " + k);
159                }
160        }
161}
